entries.subject: javascript objects and arrays
entries.text: Declare objects with curly braces. Declare arrays with square brackets.

entries.subject: javascript const actually defines a constant reference
entries.text: Usually this means whatever you declare can't change -- the exception is when it is a reference to an object or array, which remain mutable.

entries.subject: javascript arrays all have a push() method
entries.text: So myArray.push(thing) would add thing to the end of myArray

entries.subject: Javascript
entries.text: Today I learned about Application State. This client side state is where recently fetched copies of API data are stored.
